intro: Galium vernum var. hirsutissimum, commonly known as hairy woodypod, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, branching stems covered in fine, stiff hairs. The plant produces small, white to pale pink flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom in early spring. Its leaves are opposite, ovate to elliptic in shape, and often have a hairy texture. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
